name: manufactured
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
past simple and past participle of
manufacture
manufacture verb [T]
(PRODUCE)
B2 to produce goods in large numbers, usually in a factory using machines: He works for a company that manufactures car parts. The report notes a rapid decline in manufactured goods. Synonyms
fabricate especially US
make (PRODUCE)Compare
produce verb (MAKE)
Thesaurus: synonyms, antonyms, and examples

More examplesFewer examplesMercedes were pioneers during the early days of car manufacture.The number of old German cars still on the road attests to the excellence of their manufacture.Organic chemicals are used in the manufacture of plastics, fibres, solvents and paints.We manufacture undergarments that tone and slenderize.The company manufactures parts for weapons.

manufacture verb [T]
(INVENT)
to invent something, such as an excuse or story, in order to deceive someone: She insisted that every scandalous detail of the story had been manufactured. Synonyms
fabricate
invent (NOT TRUE)
make something up (INVENT)
